alert.note: Alert for Wexford (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 10:23PM EDT until April 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Manistee River near Sherman affecting Wexford County. For the Manistee River...including Sherman...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Manistee River near Sherman. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins around the Wilderness Canoe livery along left bank of river just downstream of M-37 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 15.5 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning to 14.0 feet Tuesday morning. It will rise to 14.1 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.5 feet on 03/29/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1030 AM EDT.
